result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas M. Wille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Absolute Sobriety. ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Lucas M. Wille in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Middleton states there is an issue on 14CF283 but DE would plead today to 14CF228.  Requests another date be set out in 14CF283 to get matter resolved.  Court notes 14CF283 is a Br 1 case and will be set in Br 1.  Bond continued in 14CF283.  State states recommendations in 14CF228.  Atty Middleton agrees and NC plea entered to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.
